title: A Corporation in Your Pocket: What Happens When White-Collar Work Becomes Infrastructure
author: Matt Hastings
description: As AI abstracts away white-collar work, the power to create value shifts from corporations to individuals. What does it mean to have a corporation in your pocket?

title: I Took Three Months Off from AI. Here's What I Learned When I Came Back.
author: Jill Ozovek
description: The biggest barrier to AI adoption isn't technical skill—it's the belief that you've missed too much to start. Here's why that's wrong.

title: Can You Use AI to Replace Your Employer? A Different Way to Think About the Future of Work
author: Matt Hastings
description: Instead of waiting to be replaced by AI, what if you could use AI to replace your need for an employer? Exploring a reframe for the anxious labor market.

title: The AI Time Paradox: Why You Can't Find Time for the Skill You Need Most
author: Matt Hastings
description: AI adoption is a practice skill, but the workplace pressure driving the need for AI is the same pressure stealing your time to learn it. Here's what to do about it.

title: Why AI Doesn't Work Like Regular Software: Probabilistic vs Deterministic Tools
author: Matt Hastings
description: AI is probabilistic, not deterministic. Learn why this matters and how to shift your approach for better results.

title: Why 95% of AI Projects Fail (And What To Do Instead)
author: Matt Hastings
description: The real barrier to AI adoption isn't technical—it's the gap between understanding and practice. Here's what actually works.
